reviewText: RG IS A SILLY MOVIE, WITH YOUnG GUYS WALING AROUND  WITH FUR  COATS ON  -  WITH FURRY TAILS.  WLVES ? NO. JUSTJOBLESS VAGABOnDS WHO STEAL FOOD AND ANYTHING ELSE T HEY DON'T HAVE MONEY FOR.  WHERE DoID THEY GET THE CASH FOR THOSE FUR COATS ?  THIS QUESTION  IS NEVER ADDRESSED, ALONG WITH MANY, MANY OTHERSWHICH I SUPPOSE THE SCRIPT WRITERS  APPARENTLY DID NOT THINK OF.  VERY LITTLE THOUGHT SEEMS EVIDENT HERE.THERE ARE BRIEF SCENES OF KISSING,  ALSO A STORY OF EMOTIONAL BETRAYAL  AND  HEART FELT REPENTANCE . . . FOLLOWED BY A ROMEO AND JULIEITISH VERSION OF DEATH  WHEN THE TWO LOVER WOLVES ARE SHOT AND KILLED BY THE VICAR (WHOM EVERYONE INSISTS ON CALLING  "THE PRIEST." )THE ONLY SLIGHTLY INTELLIGENT STUDY IS OF THE COUNTY GENTRY,  WHO LIVE IN A SPLR\ENDED GEORGIAN HOUSE.AND SPEAK -  OFTEN WITH AN UNDERLYING  SLIGHT COCKNEY ACCENT. NOT THE QUEEN'S ENGLISH,BUT AN ATTEMPTED FACSIMILE THEREOF . .  BUT EVEN THEN THE GENTRY SAY VERY LITTLE OF SIGNIFICANCE.NOT A GREAT FILM, NOR A GOOD FILM,  BUT  A DARK PRETENTIOUS AND OFTEN QUIITE  "SILLY " FILM. "ABSURD"WOULD BE TOO  SERIOUS  A WORD FOR THUS FILM. .  RECAP:  POOR IDEA, WORSE REALIZATION, A  MISUSE OF  POSSIBLY TALENTED  ACTORS.
summary: " ) THE ONLY SLIGHTLY INTELLIGENT STUDY IS OF THE COUNTY GENTRY

reviewText: The gay werewolf couple are endearing. The two old lady maids who plot to kill their mistress and lust in advanced age over the local Vicar are terrifying. The teenage girl who lusts after one of the wolves is spunky and forthright. Her kid brother is curious, fearless and honest to a fault... This could have been a much more interesting movie !This plays like a BBC 'made for TV' drama, but the BBC in considerably less than top form. The odd plot elements could have made for something highly unusual, but instead , you get British small town cliches.(Not so very different from American small town cliches ! The prejudiced townspeople, the repressed Vicar etc. etc.)The rural cinematography is gorgeous, but this in itself is a cliche of British small town drama.
summary: Likeable, But Scarcely Above "Made For TV" Quality

reviewText: I'm going to keep this review short as the movie doesn't deserve more than that.  I didn't care for it.  I've watched it 2 2/3 times.  The first time, I was underwhelmed.  I then watched it with the director/writer commentary.  Their insights, such as they were, did not improve my initial assessment.  After many months, I took one more look (this sometimes helps me reassess previous feelings about movies.  ....P>As an allegory for the gay experience, it's unexceptional at best.  As a retelling of fairy tales, it's weak.  Some of the direction is appealing, but the design and the script are unexceptional.My advice:  move on.  There are much better movies about werewolves.  There are much better movies about being gay.(C)2002 Joe Edkin
summary: A Werewolf Movie with No Bite

reviewText: There are three really wonderful things about this movie: James Layton, Lee Williams, and the very, VERY last scene. Most of the movie is irritating and very stupid; the story and all of the dialog are dumb; and all the other characters (especially the two old women) are nearly unbearable; but those two boys (oh my!) are so beautiful, and the very last scene is so... I don't want to spoil it, but I will just say it is very much worth holding on for; and it makes me like a silly old song for the first time in the 43 years since I first heard it.That scene and those two beautiful boys raise a one-star movie to at least four and almost to five stars. The fact that the movie as a whole is so AWFUL actually makes those three lovely assets shine even brighter. I'm going to buy a copy of this movie, which I do not often do.
summary: Two beautiful boys and one beautiful scene redeem a truly terrible movie

reviewText: The theatrical version works, the movie does not.The `Wolves of Kromer' is an adaption of Charles Lambert's play, and is meant to be a parable on both homophobia and gossip, with a strong dose of religious zeal. The main characters represent two archetypes, with Gabriel being headstrong, confident and sexually assured, and Seth being the exact opposite. In this fantasy they are both `wolves' (read gay) and as such are separate from society, existing on the fringes of Kromer a small rural town. The inhabitants tolerate the wolves, but never accept them and when the `normality' of the town is challenged in the form of a murder committed by two of their own, they react by targeting the `wolves'. Sound familiar?Homophobia also exists on the fringes in most societies, and manifests in many ways when sparked. Whilst the story is an accurate parody of such, it fails in many ways. The two main stories (murder committed by two old women and the story of the wolves themselves) are designed to ultimately intersect, they do so not by way of design but rather a forced, confusing mechanism of blame. It could have been done differently, and dare I say far more successfully. The `lessor' story of conflict in the town's priest, and his paradox was for me far more interesting. Yet the movie touches on this, almost as if it was only part of the consequence directed against the wolves. It is in fact, the main reason.The portrayal of the wolves in my opinion bordered on being spoon fed. Just in case I did not get the metaphor, a large prosthetic tail is provided for my visual education. I got the story quite quickly, and that tail did nothing more than cheapen the movie visually. It ended up being a significant annoyance, making me feel as if I was part of the ignorant masses in desperate need of visual affirmation, just in case I did not get the story.If you like art theatre, and treat such as seriously as you do your own art, you will not enjoy this movie. If you like young good-looking men, in a state of carnal inhibition and animalistic undress (but for that blasted tail) you may enjoy it a great deal. I for one expect a great deal more from cinema, and do not appreciate having good money wasted on gimmicks.
summary: What is the difference between odd and eccentric
Title: N/A

reviewText: The 1998 independent film "The Wolves of Kromer", directed by Will Gould and written by Charles Lambert and Matthew Read, is neither a horror film nor a film about werewolves in general.  Instead, the "wolves" in the film are nothing more than a euphemism for the gay community at large.  The two main wolf characters, Gabriel (James Layton in his only film) and Seth (Lee Williams in his film career debut), meet each other in the woods outside of the fictional town of Kromer, which is where many other wolves also live.  (By the way, all of the wolves are gay males.)  They spend their time wandering woods and resorting to petty theft (for the most part) to obtain money, clothing and food.  Do they ever transform into wolves as in a typical werewolf film?  No, instead they spend their time talking and walking around barefooted and always wearing cheap, second-hand faux fur coats with attached tails and beat-up shorts.  Of Kromer's "human" residents (who, by the way are all straight or deeply closeted), the film focuses upon a sick bedridden woman named Mrs Drax (Rosemarie Dunham), her housekeeper that is trying to kill her named Fanny (Rita Davies), Fanny's dimwitted diabetic friend Doreen (Margaret Towner) and Kromer's Christian priest (Kevin Moore).  As the film's story unfolds, Fanny intends to blame the impending murder of Mrs. Drax upon the wolves; and since the townsfolk regard the wolves as being inhuman, they can be hunted and killed.Though some viewers have described this film as being a modern-day romantic fairy tale, in actuality, the film (which was poorly acted, written and directed), is nothing more than an exploitation of long-standing negative stereotypes of the gay and straight communities.  Why?  First, the "wolves" are viewed by everyone else as being inhuman animals.  Second, the "wolves" are portrayed as being nothing more than criminals with no ethical center of any kind.  Third, the "wolves" are preoccupied with immediate gratification and promiscuous partying.  Fourth, the "wolves" are unworthy of being treated the same as everyone else.  Fifth, if the "wolves" are subhuman, then there are no penalties for killing them.  On the contrary, the Kromer townsfolk encourage such behavior.  Sixth, the ridiculous costumes that all of the "wolves" always wear are akin to some people's stereotype of all gay men being drag queens.  Consequently, this film is nothing more than an insult and disservice to both the gay and straight communities at large because only a very small minority of real gay men actually fit into this film's very negative stereotypes and only a minority of the actual straight community at large is as homophobic and hypocritical as this film depicts.  Therefore, I can only rate this film with 1 out of 5 stars for being grossly inaccurate, poorly acted and completely unsympathetic.  Not surprisingly, neither Will Gould nor James Layton have had any other involvement in any other film since "The Wolves of Kromer".  If you watch the film, look for the obvious blooper of when James Layton is wearing tennis shoes (instead of being barefoot) while driving a stolen motorcycle.  (He's barefoot when he & Lee Williams get onto it, but wearing shoes while driving it moments later.)  My advice: save your money and time for something better.
summary: Inaccurate Euphemisms of Negative Stereotypes & Homophobia

reviewText: Oh my!  What is there to say about "The Wolves of Kromer" other than it is one of the most ludicrous movies ever made.  It is one of those movies that holds your attention like a snake mesmerizing a bird.  Actually, it's a message movie about tolerance of those who are different.  In this subtle film, wolf=gay (in case you couldn't figure that out).  As the shotgun-wielding priest says repeatedly, "There were no wolves in Eden".  Very subtle.Our hero wolf (we know he's a wolf because he wears a fur coat with a long tail.  Very stylish!).  Anyway his  name is Gabriel (or sometimes Gabs or Andre) and he falls for the new bisexual wolf in the forest named Seth.  We have motorcycle-riding wolves and we get to see a wild wolf party on the beach, and Gabs and Seth making out.  But then Seth falls in love (or least has sex) with this unhappy girl who doesn't get along with her mother who is married to this guy whose grandmother (or mother, I couldn't really understand) is being murdered by these two old hags who like drinking and waltzing to Tchaikovsky.  I'm not sure why they are trying to kill the other old lady.  And then the townspeople all get upset about the wolves and go after them in a mob like something out of "Frankenstein".  And there's this guy, see, who shows up in a Ku Klux Klan outfit.  And it's all a tragedy, just like Romeo and Juliet, except it has a happy ending, because it turns out that, yes, Virginia, there is a wolf heaven where our heroes are able to dance around without their wolf tails with some lady who I think was the one that got murdered.  There, that's the plot.  Got it?There are a couple of pretty shots of Wales.  But the highlight of this masterpiece is getting to hear Norman Greenbaum's "Spirit in the Sky" playing while our wolf friends dance in the clouds.  Oh, and Boy George narrates the thing, only I don't remember any narration.  I guess I wasn't paying close enough attention.Everything else about his movie is appalling.  I'm guessing that the director has lots of friends who wanted to be in a movie so he included them in the cast.If you have an extra 76 minutes to kill you might want to check this one out.  It has to be seen to be believed!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love and will always this movie The Wolves of Kromer ~ Will Gould (III).  The Wolves of Kromer is now the movie I like most of all in life.  Don't buy this movie expecting your typical horror gore bloodfest because this movie does not even try to go there.  This movie addresses gay social issues, homophobia all the attendant ignorance amd hate it spawns.  Wolves and werewolves are more a recurring methaphor in the movie than fact.  Yes the script and story line could have used some tightening up.  Yes the pace was too slow and the people were a little bit too one demensional but none of that took away from the underlying power messages about how stupid homophobia is this movie sent on many levels.  Yes there could have been more action and better character development and I would agree the movie had more than its share of flaws and bad production values but, I suggest the sheer power of its political message delivered using the Wolf \ Werewolf metaphor was artistic genius and more than makes up for any cinematic lapses in style and quality in other areas.I usually hate movies that come to a tragic end but The Wolves of Kromer end's with a healthy degree of tragic irony that effectively drives the whole point of the movie home in a way worthy of the best hollywood has to offer.  I watched this movie not expecting too much and ended up getting my eyes opened and my heart stolen.  I can tell you now The Wolves of Kromer is a movie you can only understand completely if you have struggled with gay issues in your own life.  The Wolves of Kromer makes perfect sense if you dealt with your own gay issues.  I think The Wolves of Kromer is perhaps the only movie that has ever so effectively touched my heart.  I know most people will not agree with me about the awesomeness of The Wolves of Kromer but honestly I do not care.  I call them as I see them and move on!  I am happy I brought this movie it is prized in my vast DVD collection.
summary: Not Meant To Be A Typical Werewolf Movie More A Social Commentary

reviewText: .Not a drama, not a thriller, definitly not a horror film, well, what then? You got it, a comedy in way too many acts. Our big bad wolves run around the forrest with their tails sewn to their ratty, not-so-fur-like-mid-moth-eaten -coats and yap like foxes instead of wolves calls.I admit I was the one doing the howling. The only acting I was able to pick up on was the two elderly ladies and they snarled and howled more than the wolves. Actually they were waiting at GMAWS house to eat the wolves...I say, if you ever have a little...get-together for a film fest, this would get everyone off-(no not that off), on a light note. You could spend hour's picking it to pieces....and howling!!I gave it a (one)* And a 'shame-on-you', kick- in- the- cinematic- reels for wasting so much celluloid.This has set the 'gay motion picture' back to the dark ages.There were three rich guys plus Boy George who got together ,this was their first movie and hopefully their last...ciao yaaah 69
summary: OH, PLEASE GNAW ON ME MR. WOLF!!
